results.title: Drugs: The Children are choosing - The Need for dialogue
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
Reports on a conference in which students and teachers have difficulties in communicating about drugs. Finally the frustrations and problems childhood emerge and it is suggested that it is no wonder young people turn to drugs for escape and pleasure.

results.title: Using them safely
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs and Medicines”
Safely using either prescription or non-prescription drugs and medicines requires reading the label and following the directions, storing them in a safe place and avoiding leftover medicine

group_siblings.title: What is misuse

results.title: What is misuse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs and Medicine”.
Drug abuse means more than just addiction to harmful drugs. A neighbourhood pharmacist talks about the kinds of drugs and medicines being misused. His relations with his customers offer examples of varying degrees of misuse.

group_siblings.title: Using them safely

results.title: Glen Keane interview with Emma McRae
results.brief_description: Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as: ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Glen about his never-ending passion for drawing and what inspires him to create such unforgettable characters as The Beast and Ariel. Glen also talks about the changes in animation from hand drawn to digital.

results.title: Lella Smith interview with Emma McRae
results.brief_description: Lella Smith is the Creative Director of the Walt Disney Animation and Research Library and curator of the ‘Dreams Come True: The Art of Disney’s Classic Fairytales’ exhibition. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Lella about how the exhibition came about and the enormous task of selecting the films and items for exhibition from Disney’s vast archives.

results.title: Dreams come true: interviews with Glen Keane and Lella Smith
results.brief_description: ACMI curator, Emma McRae interviews Glen Keane and Lella Smith as part of the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition at ACMI. Glen Keane is an animator for Disney and has created some of the recent best-loved characters such as Ariel from ‘The Little mermaid’ and ‘The Beast’ from ‘Beauty and the beast’. Lella Smith is the creative director of Disney’s Animation Research Library and was a curator for the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition. These interviews were recorded at ACMI in conjunction with the opening of the exhibition.
results.title_for_label: Dreams come true: interviews with Glen Keane and Lella Smith
results.description: ACMI curator, Emma McRae interviews Glen Keane and Lella Smith as part of the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition at ACMI. Glen Keane is an animator for Disney and has created some of the recent best-loved characters such as Ariel from ‘The Little mermaid’ and ‘The Beast’ from ‘Beauty and the beast’. Lella Smith is the creative director of Disney’s Animation Research Library and was a curator for the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition. These interviews were recorded at ACMI in conjunction with the opening of the exhibition.

Lella Smith is the creative director of Disney’s Animation Research Library and was a curator for the ‘Disney : dreams come true’ exhibition. These interviews were recorded at ACMI in conjunction with the opening of the exhibition.

results.title: Dragons tongue. - Series 2.
results.creator_credit: Robin James, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A series of lessons in the Chinese language intended for high school students using simple vocabulary and brief dramatisations utilising the vocabulary. Includes short sections about life in modern China and a segment on Chinese writing and calligraphy. Introduced by Colin McKerras.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin James, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
